files.description: Python CLI tool that scans agent-specific and runtime output locations, selects best-known deliverables, migrates them into canonical /outputs structure, and writes a detailed canonicalization report under outputs/tracking/ or outputs/qa/ including moves, collisions, and chosen winners.
Reusable library implementing discovery, scoring, collision resolution, safe move/copy, and report generation logic used by the canonicalization script.
Shell script that executes the canonicalization CLI with sensible defaults and exits nonzero on failure for QA/runtime automation.
Placeholder file to ensure outputs/tracking directory exists for canonicalization reports in clean checkouts.
Placeholder file to ensure outputs/qa directory exists for canonicalization reports when QA mode is used.

missionDescription: Perform a canonicalization pass by scanning agent-specific and runtime/outputs locations and migrating the best-known deliverables into the chosen canonical /outputs structure; produce a canonicalization report (moved files, collisions, chosen winners) under /outputs/tracking/ or /outputs/qa/.
missionSuccessCriteria: Complete strategic task identified by Meta-Coordinator or escalated by Strategic Tracker

Deliverables are scattered across multiple paths (agent-specific, runtime/outputs, /outputs). Without a deterministic migration, ARTIFACT_INDEX and QA will continue to point to inconsistent locations.
